abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as satisfactory and project sustainability is good and
            categorized as "likely." World Bank performance in
            project identification, preparation, and appraisal was
            satisfactory while Bank supervision is rated as highly
            satisfactory. Throughout the project, the Bank maintained
            good relations with the Government and the Borrower. Overall
            borrower performance is rated satisfactory. The following
            lessons could be learned from the project's
            implementation. Actions on land acquisition and construction
            permits must be taken early on during project preparation
            and should be completed as much as possible in the early
            stage of project implementation to avoid or minimize
            implementation delays. In this case, where there were many
            project components, waiting to complete all land acquisition
            would hinder the project from starting. Realistic
            implementation schedules should be prepared at project
            appraisal by taking into full consideration all potential
            risk factors (such as land acquisition, necessary government
            approvals, procurement process, etc.) that could affect
            project implementation. To achieve successful and smooth
            corporatization and or restructuring, adequate attention
            should be given to ensure that all stakeholders including
            employee unions participate in the process actively from the
            very beginning, and that they fully understand the process,
            and their concerns are properly addressed during the process.
